text:

text: Did you know...Exeter prison was built in 1853. A typical Victorian design, by local architect John Hayward. The prison was based on the plan of the model prison at Pentonville. Interesting.... #history #exeter #hmp #devoncountyprison #time #prison https://t.co/vdrqAwHQMF

user_description:
Low Newton is a prison and young offender institute (YOI) in Brasside, near Durham, for women aged 18 and over.

Follow us for updates, stories and news.

text: Our cases are reducing day on day, as are any new cases.  Purple video visits continue to operate our extended schedule, however in line with our current regime level, social visits remain paused, we hope to resume these week in a limited capacity week commencing 28th December.

text: Above all, Richard is a loyal, thoughtful, inspiring, and aspirational person who was highly thought of as a colleague and leader. There aren't enough words to thank him for the significant contribution he has made. We would like to wish him well on a long and happy retirement.

Please consider vulnerable family members when making plans & stay safe. 
More info: https://t.co/k3ik23vWGt https://t.co/S0uwRoE0RG

text:
Message from our Governor:
Our thoughts are with anyone affected by COVID. Everyone is working hard both staff and residents in keeping safe, hopefully Tier 3 restrictions will be soon lifted so we can reconvene domestic visits, and ROTL when safe to do so.

text:
HMP Featherstone have been declared an outbreak site due to the high number of positive COVID19 tests. 
Unfortunately this means we have had to make the decision to suspend social visits. This decision will be reviewed weekly and visits will be reinstated when it is safe to do so

text: As part of Black History Month we are celebrating Mary Seacole, a pioneering nurse and heroine of the Crimean War, who as a woman of mixed race overcame a double prejudice. Our therapies centre, the Seacole Centre, is named after her.  #BlackHistoryMonth2020 https://t.co/KRBLHk0t4K
